heisigStory: Tiger . . . box with a one in it (or a backwards broom, if that makes it easier).
koohiiStory1: Here we see the evil tyrannizing tiger. What is on his chest? A giant E, for EVIL, of course.
koohiiStory2: The "E" shape actually means claws here, and the real etymology is a tiger tyrannizing other animals with its claws (the etymologies actually make sense once in a blue moon!). I think of the claws here as two hooks, representing the front paws. (stroke order of that part: 二＋last of 直).
